qas.question: What did Paul VI enact between the third and fourth ecumenical sessions?
What does the Catholic church considered "mixed" in a "mixed marriage"?
What is celebrated in the Catholic calendar the 8 of December?

answers.text: the Feast of the Immaculate Conception.

qas.question: In what year was Paul Vi's final counsel session?
With whom did Paul VI celebrate surviving persecution in other countries?

context: Between the third and fourth sessions the pope announced <a0_0>reforms<a0_0/> in the areas of Roman Curia, revision of Canon Law, regulations for mixed marriages involving several <a1_0>faiths<a1_0/>, and birth control issues. He opened the final session of the council, concelebrating with <a4_0>bishops<a4_0/> from countries where the Church was persecuted. Several texts proposed for his approval had to be changed. But all texts were finally agreed upon. The Council was concluded on 8 December <a3_0>1965<a3_0/>, <a2_0>the Feast of the Immaculate Conception.
